meanings.definition: The state or quality of being a king.
meanings.sent1: In fairy tales, the kinghoods are always portrayed as wise and powerful rulers.
meanings.sent2: The history books often discuss the kinghoods of different monarchs throughout the centuries.
meanings.sent3: The children at the costume party argued over who would get to wear the kinghoods and rule the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: His kindness and generosity elevated him to the kinghoods of the community.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering crown symbolized the ultimate kinghoods in the land.

meanings.sent1: Legends speak of a grand assembly where all the kinghoods gathered to discuss peace.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed portraits of the various kinghoods from different eras.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends jokingly referred to themselves as the kinghoods of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The chess pieces represented the different kinghoods on the battlefield of strategy.
meanings.sent5: The tapestries depicted the unity and strength of the kinghoods across the lands.

meanings.definition: The office or position of a king.
meanings.sent1: The grand throne room was where the kinghoods conducted their royal duties.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony marked the official transfer of the kinghoods to the new ruler.
meanings.sent3: The royal advisor always made sure the kinghoods were well-informed of the kingdom's affairs.
meanings.sent4: She aspired to reach the highest kinghoods and lead with wisdom and compassion.
meanings.sent5: The crown prince eagerly awaited the day he would assume the kinghoods of his father.
